TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {67236=Straight is the Dormitory that is supposed to be haunted ( i don't believe it.) The Oaks is possibly the most sacred place on campus because of it's beauty and because of what it means to march up the Oaks for graduation., 189228=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 41202=there are 5 dorms on campus 3 of them are under construction due to katrina, which will reopen in fall 2012. there are 3 off campus sites for sudents and staff, the university provides a shuttle for off campus students in the university housing., 164717=The campus is filled with historic oak trees. When students gradute they march down the oaks to receive their diplomas., 118503=Dillard is prestigious black private institution. We about our business and profressionalism yet the fun of New Orleans at the same time. I am a freshman 2012, they welcome you with open arms.. they instantly became family., 24253=I have had the pleasure to eat the cajun inspired cuisine of Dillard University, because the University is located in New Orleans, LA they always have the best food. You can find everything from gumbo to freshly made sandwiches in the dinning hall Kearny. In Kearny there is always friendly staff members around to assist with any needs, as well as flat screen televisions and the latest music playing through speakers.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Students looking for a Historically Black College or University that can cater to the major of their choice. Tips for prospective students Student teacher ratio is where you are not just a number on the roll. Each professor gets to know each student on a one on one basis. Bang for the buck The tuition is based on a private institution, so financial aid is a very important asset. Am enjoying being here I enjoy the surroundings of Dillard University and the Staff has welcomed me with open arms. Am learning a lot I have been elected as the Freshman Class President and my classes are very interesting and the professors really care about the students learning abilities and assist with getting help if needed.
